alert.note: Alert for Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 12:40AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Marengo and south central Sumter Counties through 130 AM CST... At 1239 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pennington, or 12 miles northeast of Butler, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Linden, Jefferson, Thomaston, Myrtlewood, Dayton, Freddie Jones Field, Pin Hook, Miller, Chickasaw State Park, Half Acre, Old Spring Hill, Octagon, Calvary, Whitfield and Oakchia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southwestern and west central Alabama.
